Interface ServiceOrderManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServiceOrderManager

    public interface ServiceOrderManagerInterface
    This class that holds all the service order objects in the ordered linked-lists that keep the objects ordered based on a particular key. This class adds to the data structures (Start Service) and deletes from the data structures (Finish Service). It also returns the contents of the ordered linked lists. Used for Assignment 2 Fall 2012
    Author:
    Professor Myers

    • Method Detail

      • startService

        boolean startService(int orderNum,
                   java.lang.String owner,
                   java.lang.String make,
                   java.lang.String model,
                   int year)
                     throws ServiceOrderInUseException
        Creates a Service Order object and adds it to the ordered linked lists
        Parameters:
        orderNum - Service Order Number
        owner - name of owner of car to be serviced
        make - make of car to be serviced
        model - model of car to be serviced
        year - year of car to be serviced
        Returns:
        true if the startService was successful
        Throws:
        ServiceOrderInUseException - if Service Order Number is already in use

      • startService

        boolean startService(ServiceOrderInterface order)
                     throws ServiceOrderInUseException
        Adds a Service Order to the ordered linked lists. This is for testing purposes. Not intended to be used by the user
        Parameters:
        order - a Service Order to be added to the ordered linked lists.
        Returns:
        true if the startService was successful
        Throws:
        ServiceOrderInUseException - if Service Order Number is already in use

      • finishService

        boolean finishService(int orderNum)
                      throws ServiceOrderNotFoundException
        Removes the Service Order from the ordered linked lists using the service order number
        Parameters:
        orderNum - Service Order Number
        Returns:
        true if the finishService is successful
        Throws:
        ServiceOrderNotFoundException - if the Service Order Number is not found

      • listByKeyTable

        java.lang.String[][] listByKeyTable(int key)
        Returns a two dimensional array of Strings. This can be used to populate a JTable
        Parameters:
        key, - how service orders are to be ordered 1 = service order number, 2 = owner name (last, first), 3 = make,model,year of car
        Returns:
        a two dimensional array of Strings to populate a JTable

      • listByKeyVector

        java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> listByKeyVector(int key)
        Returns a Vector of Strings. This can be used to populate a JList
        Parameters:
        key - how service orders are to be ordered 1 = service order number, 2 = owner name (last, first), 3 = make,model,year of car
        Returns:
        a Vector of Strings to populate a JList

      • outputFileFormat

        java.lang.String outputFileFormat()
        Returns a string with all the current Service Orders in the following format: Line Information 1 Order # (integer) 2 Name (last name, first name) (String) 3 Make (String) 4 Model (String) 5 Year (String) ** No blank lines between Service Orders The orders are placed in the string in order by Service Order Number, i.e. order# 1001 is before order# 3208
        Returns:
        a String that can be used with a PrintWriter object to write to a file.
